intro: Wikstroemia subspicata, commonly known as the Hawaiian hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the family Thymelaeaceae and is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and often covered with fine hairs, while its bark is smooth and reddish in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and upland habitats across Hawaii.
